claim: Some votes cast in 2010 on the Codebase Community were submitted from mobile devices such as smartphones.
reasoning: The claim references the device type (mobile/smartphone) used to cast votes, but the votes table has no column for device type, user agent, platform, or any similar attribute. This is out-of-schema information that cannot be verified from the database.

content.text: I need to check if the database contains any information about the device type (mobile/smartphone) used when votes were cast.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

tool_use_result.stdout:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

input.description: Check the schema of the votes table

content.content:
CREATE TABLE votes
(
    Id           INTEGER  not null
        primary key,
    PostId       INTEGER  null,
    VoteTypeId   INTEGER  null,
    CreationDate DATE null,
    UserId       INTEGER  null,
    BountyAmount INTEGER  null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE votes
(
    Id           INTEGER  not null
        primary key,
    PostId       INTEGER  null,
    VoteTypeId   INTEGER  null,
    CreationDate DATE null,
    UserId       INTEGER  null,
    BountyAmount INTEGER  null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text:
The `votes` table has columns: `Id`, `PostId`, `VoteTypeId`, `CreationDate`, `UserId`, and `BountyAmount`. There is no column indicating what device was used to cast a vote (e.g., no "DeviceType", "UserAgent", "Platform", or similar column).

The claim asserts that votes were "submitted from mobile devices such as smartphones" — this references device type information that is entirely absent from the database schema. This is an **OUT-OF-SCHEMA** situation.

